extends Object

      Constructor and Description
      ByteStream(byte[] byteArray)
      Creates a ByteStream to read data from a byte array.

      Creates a ByteStream to read data from a file.

      Reads an array of bytes from the stream.

      Reads a big-endian long value with a variable byte size from the stream.

      Skip forward in the stream by a specific byte count.

      • ByteStream

        public ByteStream(File toOpen)
           throws FileNotFoundException
        Creates a ByteStream to read data from a file.
        Parameters:
        toOpen - The file data source.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist.

      • ByteStream

        public ByteStream(byte[] byteArray)
        Creates a ByteStream to read data from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - An array of bytes to access through the stream.

    • Method Detail

      • getStreamPos

        public int getStreamPos()
        Gets the stream's current position within the file or byte array.
        Returns:
        The index of the next byte in the stream.

      • available

        public int available()
        Get an estimate of the number of remaining bytes that can be read from the stream without blocking.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes available.

      • readByte

        public byte readByte()
              throws IOException
        Reads a single byte from the stream at the current position.
        Returns:
        The next byte.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the byte could not be read.

      • readShort

        public short readShort()
                throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian, two byte short value from the stream.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the short could not be read.

      • readInt

        public int readInt()
            throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian, four byte int value from the stream.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the int could not be read.

      • readFloat

        public float readFloat()
                throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian, four byte float value from the stream.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the float could not be read.

      • readDouble

        public double readDouble()
                  throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian, eight byte double value from the stream.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the double could not be read.

      • readInt

        public int readInt(int byteSize)
            throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian int value with a variable byte size from the stream.
        Parameters:
        byteSize - The number of bytes to read into the integer. This value should not be greater than four or less than zero.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the int could not be read, either because of a file IO issue or because byteSize was invalid.

      • readLong

        public long readLong()
              throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian, eight byte long value from the stream.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the long could not be read.

      • readLong

        public long readLong(int byteSize)
              throws IOException
        Reads a big-endian long value with a variable byte size from the stream.
        Parameters:
        byteSize - The number of bytes to read into the integer. This value should not be greater than eight or less than zero.
        Returns:
        The value that was read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the int could not be read, either because of a file IO issue or because byteSize was invalid.

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int size)
                 throws IOException
        Reads an array of bytes from the stream.
        Parameters:
        size - Maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        A new array holding all returned bytes, with a length exactly equal to the number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        IOException - If no bytes could be read, or an error occurred when reading from the file.

      • skip

        public long skip(long toSkip)
          throws IOException
        Skip forward in the stream by a specific byte count.
        Parameters:
        toSkip - Maximum number of bytes to skip.
        Returns:
        Actual number of bytes skipped.
        Throws:
        IOException - For any of the reasons FileInputStream.skip would throw an IOException.

      • readToBuffer

        public int readToBuffer(int size)
                 throws IOException
        Buffer up to size stream bytes.
        Parameters:
        size - The number of bytes to buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes that were actually buffered.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any errors occur when reading from the source file.
